member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.AutoCompleteType
member.summary: The AutomCompleteType is a string-associated enum of browser-supported autocomplete attribute values.
member.remarks: This class lists the autocomplete attirbute options allowing developers to provide the browser with guidance on how to pre-populate the form fields. It is a class rather than a simpler enum to associate each option with the string the browser expects. For more information please review the list of options (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) and the spec (https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/form-control-infrastructure.html#autofill).

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenChart
member.summary: Displays line, area, donut, pie, bar or column series.

example.code:
<RadzenChart>
                  <RadzenColumnSeries Data=@revenue CategoryProperty="Quarter" ValueProperty="Revenue" />
              </RadzenChart>
              @code {
                  class DataItem
                  {
                      public string Quarter { get; set; }
                      public double Revenue { get; set; }
                  }
                  DataItem[] revenue = new DataItem[]
                  {
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q1", Revenue = 234000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q2", Revenue = 284000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q3", Revenue = 274000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q4", Revenue = 294000 }
                  };
              }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCompareValidator
member.summary: A validator component which compares a component value with a specified value. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <RadzenPassword style="display: block" Name="Password" @bind-Value=@model.Password />
               <RadzenPassword style="display: block" Name="RepeatPassword" @bind-Value=@model.RepeatPassword />
               <RadzenCompareValidator Value=@model.Password Component="RepeatPassword" Text="Passwords should be the same"  Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class Model
               {
                 public string Password { get; set; }
                 public double Value { get; set; }
                 public string RepeatPassword { get; set; }
               }
               Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCompareValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Value should match" by default.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCompareValidator.Value
member.summary: Specifies the value to compare with.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCompareValidator.Operator
member.summary: Specifies the comparison operator. Set to CompareOperator.Equal by default.

member.value: true if should be validated; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCustomValidator
member.summary: A validator component which compares a component value with a specified value. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
                <RadzenTextBox Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
                <RadzenCustomValidator Value=@model.Email Component="Email" Text="Email must be unique" Validator="@(() => ValidateNewEmail(model.Email))" Style="position: absolute" />
             </RadzenTemplateForm>
             @code {
                class Model
                {
                     public string Email { get; set; }
                }
                Model model = new Model();
            
                string[] emails = new string[] { "andy@smith" };
            
                bool ValidateNewEmail(string email)
                {
                    return !emails.Any(e => e.ToUpper().Equals(email.ToUpper()));
                }
             }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCustomValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Value should match" by default.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCustomValidator.Validator
member.summary: Specifies the function which validates the component value. Must return true if the component is valid.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenDataAnnotationValidator
member.summary: A validator component which validates a component value using the data annotations defined on the corresponding model property. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="UserModel" Data=@user>
               <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Name" @bind-Value=@user.Name />
               <RadzenFieldValidator Component="Name" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class UserModel
               {
                  [Required(ErrorMessage = "Name is required.")]
                  [StringLength(50, ErrorMessage = "Name must be less than 50 characters.")]
                  public string Name { get; set; }
               }
               UserModel user = new UserModel();
            }

member.summary: Gets or sets the separator used to join multiple validation messages.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenEmailValidator
member.summary: A validator component which checks if a component value is a valid email address. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
              <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
              <RadzenEmailValidator Component="Email" Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
             class Model
              {
               public string Email { get; set; }
             }
             
             Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenGoogleMap
member.summary: RadzenGoogleMap component.

example.code:
<RadzenGoogleMap Zoom="3" Center=@(new GoogleMapPosition() { Lat = 42.6977, Lng = 23.3219 }) MapClick=@OnMapClick MarkerClick=@OnMarkerClick">
                <Markers>
                    <RadzenGoogleMapMarker Title="London" Label="London" Position=@(new GoogleMapPosition() { Lat = 51.5074, Lng = 0.1278 }) />
                    <RadzenGoogleMapMarker Title="Paris " Label="Paris" Position=@(new GoogleMapPosition() { Lat = 48.8566, Lng = 2.3522 }) />
                </Markers>
            </RadzenGoogleMap>
            @code {
              void OnMapClick(GoogleMapClickEventArgs args)
              {
                Console.WriteLine($"Map clicked at Lat: {args.Position.Lat}, Lng: {args.Position.Lng}");
              }
              
              void OnMarkerClick(RadzenGoogleMapMarker marker)
              {
                Console.WriteLine($"Map {marker.Title} marker clicked. Marker position -> Lat: {marker.Position.Lat}, Lng: {marker.Position.Lng}");
              }
            }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLengthValidator
member.summary: A validator component which checks if then component value length is within a specified range. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="FirstName" @bind-Value=@model.FirstName />
               <RadzenLengthValidator Component="FirstName" Min="3" Text="First name should be at least 3 characters" Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class Model
               {
                  public string FirstName { get; set; }
               }
               Model model = new Model(); 
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLengthValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Invalid length" by default.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLengthValidator.Min
member.summary: Specifies the minimum accepted length. The component value length should be greater than the minimum in order to be valid.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLengthValidator.Max
member.summary: Specifies the maximum accepted length. The component value length should be less than the maximum in order to be valid.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLogin
member.summary: RadzenLogin component. Must be placed in RadzenTemplateForm.

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm Data=@("Login")>
                     <RadzenLogin AllowRegister="true" AllowResetPassword="true"
                                     Login=@OnLogin
                                     ResetPassword=@OnResetPassword
                                     Register=@OnRegister />
             </RadzenTemplateForm>
             @code {
               void OnLogin(LoginArgs args, string name)
               {
                 Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> Username: {args.Username} and password: {args.Password}");
               }
            
               void OnRegister(string name)
               {
                 Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> Register");
               }
            
               void OnResetPassword(string value, string name)
               {
                 Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> ResetPassword for user: {value}");
               }
             }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenMarkdown.AllowedHtmlAttributes

< RadzenMediaQuery Query="(max-width: 768px)" Change=@OnChange />

              void OnChange(bool matches)

              }
            }

member.summary: Specifies the y coordinate of the pie center. Not set by default which centers pie vertically.

member.summary: Specifies the radius of the pie. Not set by default - the pie takes as much size of the chart as possible.

member.summary: Gets or sets the start angle from which segments are rendered (clockwise). Set to 90 by default. Top is 90, right is 0, bottom is 270, left is 180.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRegexValidator
member.summary: A validator component which matches a component value against a specified regular expression pattern. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="ZIP" @bind-Value=@model.Zip />
               <RadzenRegexValidator Component="ZIP" Text="ZIP code must be 5 digits" Pattern="\d{5}" Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class Model
               {
                  public string Zip { get; set; }
               }
               Model model = new Model(); 
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRegexValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Value should match" by default.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRegexValidator.Pattern
member.summary: Specifies the regular expression pattern which the component value should match in order to be valid.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRequiredValidator
member.summary: A validator component which checks if a component has value. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
              <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
              <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
             class Model
             {
               public string Email { get; set; }
             }
             
             Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRequiredValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Required" by default.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRequiredValidator.DefaultValue
member.summary: Specifies a default value. If the component value is equal to DefaultValue it is considered invalid.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1
member.summary: Displays a collection of in day, week or month view.
member.typeparam: The type of the value item.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data="@data" TItem="DataItem" StartProperty="Start" EndProperty="End" TextProperty="Text">
                <RadzenMonthView />
            </RadzenScheduler>
            @code {
                class DataItem
                {
                    public DateTime Start { get; set; }
                    public DateTime End { get; set; }
                    public string Text { get; set; }
                }
                DataItem[] data = new DataItem[]
                {
                    new DataItem
                    {
                        Start = DateTime.Today,
                        End = DateTime.Today.AddDays(1),
                        Text = "Birthday"
                    },
                };
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.NavigationTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional content to be rendered in place of the default navigation buttons in the scheduler. This property allows for complete customization of the navigation controls, replacing the native date navigation buttons (such as year, month, and day) with user-defined content or buttons. Use this to add custom controls or interactive elements that better suit your application's requirements. This requires that the ShowHeader parameter to be set to true (enabled by default).
member.value: The custom navigation template to replace default navigation buttons.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.Data

member.value: The name of the property. Must be a DateTime property.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.SlotSelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks a slot in the current view. Commonly used to add new appointments.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.TodaySelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks the Today button.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments TodaySelect=@OnTodaySelect>
            </RadzenScheduler>
            @code {
            void OnTodaySelect(SchedulerTodaySelectEventArgs args)
            {
                args.Today = DateTime.Today.AddDays(1);
            }
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.MonthSelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks a month header button.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments MonthSelect=@OnMonthSelect>
            </RadzenScheduler>
            @code {
            void OnMonthSelect(SchedulerMonthSelectEventArgs args)
            {
                var selectedMonth = args.MonthStart.Month;
            }
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.DaySelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks a day header button or the day number in a MonthView.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments DaySelect=@OnDaySelect>
            </RadzenScheduler>
            @code {
            void OnDaySelect(SchedulerDaySelectEventArgs args)
            {
                var selectedDay = args.Day;
            }
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.AppointmentSelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks an appointment in the current view. Commonly used to edit existing appointments.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.AppointmentMouseEnter
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user moves the mouse over an appointment in the current view.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.AppointmentMouseLeave
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user moves the mouse out of an appointment in the current view.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.MoreSelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks the more text in the current view. Commonly used to view additional appointments. Invoke the method to prevent the default action (showing the additional appointments).

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments MoreSelect=@OnMoreSelect>
            </RadzenScheduler>
            @code {
             void OnMoreSelect(SchedulerMoreSelectEventArgs args)
             {
                args.PreventDefault();
             }
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.AppointmentRender
member.summary: An action that will be invoked when the current view renders an appointment. Never call StateHasChanged when handling AppointmentRender.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments AppointmentRender=@OnAppointmentRendert>
             </RadzenScheduler>
             @code {
               void OnAppintmentRender(SchedulerAppointmentRenderEventArgs<TItem> args)
               {
                 if (args.Data.Text == "Birthday")
                 {
                    args.Attributes["style"] = "color: red;"
                 }
            .  }
             }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.SlotRender
member.summary: An action that will be invoked when the current view renders an slot. Never call StateHasChanged when handling SlotRender.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments SlotRender=@OnSlotRender>
            </RadzenScheduler>
            @code {
              void OnSlotRender(SchedulerSlotRenderEventArgs args)
              {
                if (args.View.Text == "Month" && args.Start.Date == DateTime.Today)
                {
                   args.Attributes["style"] = "background: red;";
                }
              }
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.LoadData
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the scheduler needs data for the current view. Commonly used to filter the data assigned to .

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.AppointmentMove
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when an appointment is being dragged and then dropped on a different slot. Commonly used to change it to a different timeslot.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments AppointmentMove=@OnAppointmentMove>
            </RadzenScheduler>
            @code {
              async Task OnAppointmentMove(SchedulerAppointmentMoveEventArgs moved)
              {
                var draggedAppointment = appointments.SingleOrDefault(x => x == (Appointment)moved.Appointment.Data);
                if (draggedAppointment != null)
                {
                    draggedAppointment.Start = draggedAppointment.Start + moved.TimeSpan;
                    draggedAppointment.End = draggedAppointment.End + moved.TimeSpan;
                    await scheduler.Reload();
                }
              }
            }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenSeriesAnnotation`1
member.summary: Displays a text label for the specified data item from the series.

example.code:
<RadzenChart>
                  <RadzenLineSeries Data=@revenue CategoryProperty="Quarter" ValueProperty="Revenue">
                     <RadzenSeriesAnnotation Data="@revenue[1] Text="Q2 Revenue" />
                  </RadzenLineSeries>
              </RadzenChart>
              @code {
                  class DataItem
                  {
                      public string Quarter { get; set; }
                      public double Revenue { get; set; }
                  }
                  DataItem[] revenue = new DataItem[]
                  {
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q1", Revenue = 234000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q2", Revenue = 284000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q3", Revenue = 274000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q4", Revenue = 294000 }
                  };
              }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1
member.summary: A component which represents a form. Provides validation support.

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
               <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
             </RadzenTemplateForm>
             @code {
              class Model
              {
                public string Email { get; set; }
              }
            
              Model model = new Model();
             }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.IsValid
member.summary: Returns the validity of the form.
member.value: true if all validators in the form a valid; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.Data
member.summary: Specifies the model of the form. Required to support validation.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.ChildContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the child content.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.Submit
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user submits the form and is true.

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Submit=@OnSubmit Data=@model>
               <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
               <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
             </RadzenTemplateForm>
             @code {
              class Model
               {
                public string Email { get; set; }
              }
            
              Model model = new Model();
            
              void OnSubmit(Model value)
              {
            
              }
             }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.OnInvalidSubmit
member.summary: Obsolete. Use instead.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.InvalidSubmit
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user submits the form and is false.

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" InvalidSubmit=@OnInvalidSubmit Data=@model>
               <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
               <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
             </RadzenTemplateForm>
             @code {
              class Model
              {
                public string Email { get; set; }
              }
            
              Model model = new Model();
            
              void OnInvalidSubmit(FormInvalidSubmitEventArgs args)
              {
            
              }
             }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.Method
member.summary: Specifies the form method attribute. Used together with .

example.code: <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Method="post" Action="/register" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm>

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1.Action
member.summary: Specifies the form action attribute. When set the form submits to the specified URL.

example.code: <RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Method="post" Action="/register" Data=@model> <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email /> <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" /> </RadzenTemplateForm>

example.code: <RadzenTree> <RadzenTreeItem Text="BMW"> <RadzenTreeItem Text="M3" /> <RadzenTreeItem Text="M5" /> </RadzenTreeItem> <RadzenTreeItem Text="Audi"> <RadzenTreeItem Text="RS4" /> <RadzenTreeItem Text="RS6" /> </RadzenTreeItem> <RadzenTreeItem Text="Mercedes"> <RadzenTreeItem Text="C63 AMG" /> <RadzenTreeItem Text="S63 AMG" /> </RadzenTreeItem> </RadzenTree>

example.code:
<RadzenTree Change=@OnChange> <RadzenTreeItem Text="BMW"> <RadzenTreeItem Text="M3" /> <RadzenTreeItem Text="M5" /> </RadzenTreeItem> <RadzenTreeItem Text="Audi"> <RadzenTreeItem Text="RS4" /> <RadzenTreeItem Text="RS6" /> </RadzenTreeItem> <RadzenTreeItem Text="Mercedes"> <RadzenTreeItem Text="C63 AMG" /> <RadzenTreeItem Text="S63 AMG" /> </RadzenTreeItem> </RadzenTree> @code { void OnChange(TreeEventArgs args) {
} }

} }

member.returns: A task to wait for the operation to complete.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTreeLevel
member.summary: Configures a level of nodes in a during data-binding.

example.code:
<RadzenTree Data=@rootEmployees>
                <RadzenTreeLevel TextProperty="LastName" ChildrenProperty="Employees1"  HasChildren=@(e => (e as Employee).Employees1.Any()) />
            </RadzenTree>
            @code {
             IEnumerable<Employee> rootEmployees; 
             protected override void OnInitialized()
             {
                rootEmployees = NorthwindDbContext.Employees.Where(e => e.ReportsTo == null);
             }
            }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenUpload
member.summary: RadzenUpload component.

example.code:
<RadzenUpload Url="upload/single" Progress=@(args => OnProgress(args, "Single file upload"))/>
             @code {
              void OnProgress(UploadProgressArgs args, string name)
              {
                this.info = $"% '{name}' / {args.Loaded} of {args.Total} bytes.";
                this.progress = args.Progress;
                if (args.Progress == 100)
                {
                    console.Clear();
            
                    foreach (var file in args.Files)
                    {
                        console.Log($"Uploaded: {file.Name} / {file.Size} bytes");
                    }
                }
              }
             }

member.name: T:Radzen.NotificationService
member.summary: Class NotificationService. Contains various methods with options to open notifications. Should be added as scoped service in the application services and RadzenNotification should be added in application main layout.

example.code: @inject NotificationService NotificationService <RadzenButton Text="Show info notification" Click=@(args => NotificationService.Notify(new NotificationMessage { Severity = NotificationSeverity.Info, Summary = "Info Summary", Detail = "Info Detail", Duration = 4000 })) / >
